page.title: 11QUARRY
page.content: Apart from the farms, the only other employer of any importance in our area is the local quarry. Based on the plug of an extinct volcano, the stone quarried is whinstone, a hard, black stone which is crushed to make chips for road metal. Some 6 men in the village of Newbigging, and a further 4 from the village of Wellbank find employment there. The site extends to some 14 acres, and with only 6 years of its lease to run, there is speculation locally as to what will happen to the site when quarrying ceases. Being close to Dundee, the large hole created would be a prime site for dumping waste of all sorts, and some concern has been expressed about this locally. At the moment, there is little pollution from the quarry, either in the form of noise, dust or heavy traffic.
